text: hello and welcome to my cupcake
addiction where today I'm gonna be
showing you how to make these amazingly
delicious no-bake Oreo cheesecake
cupcakes so these are perfect individual
sized portions of decadent cookies and
cream cheese cake and you can make them
in regular cupcake size you can make me
a muffin size or in minis depending on
what you want to use them for let's get
started the things that you need to make
your cheesecakes you're gonna need an
electric mixer for this and I've got
both the whisk attachment and a paddle
but either all will do I've got some
second cream so for me this is a
whipping cream it's about a 35 to 40
percent milk fat depending on where
you're living it may be called different
things I've got some castor sugar or
superfine sugar a little bit of lemon
juice a pinch of salt and I'm using some
vanilla sugar today you can replace this
with clear vanilla extract or you can
use vanilla essence but if you're using
a colored vanilla essence just be aware
that it may change the color of your
finished cheesecakes ever so slightly
I've got one regular packet of Oreo
cookies which I've crushed I've left
them relatively chunky but still
definitely crushed a packet of minis
which I've left whole some softened
cream cheese and a spoon and another
packet of Oreo biscuits which I'm
leaving hole to line my cupcakes of
course I've got my cupcake tray and I've
got 12 cupcake liners for the printable
version of this recipe including all of
your measurements conversions and
quantities you can head to the my
cupcake addiction blog I will leave a
link to that post in the description box
below and trust me you want to print
this recipe it's gonna be a new favorite
I've also got a disposable piping bag
and I'm using a large open star tip
piping nozzle I'm using the bagging tip
today to decorate my cupcakes but you
could also get just a can of your Dream
Whip or your canned whipped cream if you
want to save a little bit of time and a
couple of extra pieces of equipment so
the first thing you want to do is you
want to pour in that cream and you
should have another amount of cream
sitting off to the side for decoration
but your recipe amount of cream needs to
be whipped on a higher speed until it is
Semmy wit you don't want to whip this
till it's super firm because otherwise
when we mix it into the rest of our mix
you risk over whipping it so you can see
that it really should just kind of
dollop off the spoon by itself pour that
cream into a separate Bowl and sit it
off to the side and I'm actually going
to switch to my paddle attachment here
but like I said it really doesn't matter
add in your softened cream cheese your
superfine or castor sugar your lemon
juice your pinch of salt and your
vanilla sugar or your clear vanilla
extract and then you want to lower those
beaters down and you want to mix them on
a low speed to begin with and then
turning them up to high speeds until
they are thoroughly creamed it's about
two minutes once your cream cheese
mixture almost resembles whipped cream
you want to take that whipped cream that
you've set aside and pour it into the
bowl turn it back on to a high speed but
the key here is that we don't want to
over whip so I'm really only turning it
on for about 10 to 20 seconds to
thoroughly combine those ingredients
together and then switch it off so we
don't over whip that cream and we're
going to move to a hand mixer or just a
large spoon pour in all of your Oreo
cookies and we're just gonna mix these
through by hand this is once again to
get an even distribution but to make
sure we're not over whipping the cream
once they're mixed all the way through
you want to take your cupcake tray with
your cupcake liners and we're going to
position a whole Oreo cookie from that
second packet into the base of each
making sure the cookies in the center
now I'm going to take a tablespoon and
I'm just going to put tablespoons of the
mixture into each of those cupcake
wrappers try to be careful not to mess
around with the Oreo in the bottom
because you really want that to stay in
the center once you've got your initial
amount of your cheesecake mixture tap it
down on the bench give it a couple of
really good fangs so that you're forcing
that Cheesecake down around the edges of
that Oreo cookie in the base and then
you want to fill it up now this mixture
is actually going to sink a tiny bit in
the middle so you kind of want to build
them up in the center a little bit and
then you can sort of even them off using
a knife down towards the edges of the
cupcake wrapper when you actually serve
there is I would generally take the
cupcake wrapper off so by evening them
off or pushing their mix all the way to
the edges you still kind of get that
really nice little cupcake you look I
like to set these in the freezer so
they're really firm for decorating so
two to four hours in the freezer should
make them nice and firm and then you
want to take some finely crushed Oreos
and I'm just going to rim around
the very very edges of that Oreo cookie
cheesecake to add in a little bit more
cookie but I'm also to give it a bit of
color and a bit of texture your
additional decorating whipped cream
should be whipped really nice and firm
so you don't want to send me whip it you
want a fully whip it to give you a nice
pot and I'm just popping that into that
disposable piping bag and doing like a
sundae style of swirl so you can see I'm
starting in the center of each
cheesecake and I'm lifting the bag as
I'm squeezing that cream out and then
tapering it to a point at the top I like
to add one whole mini Oreo on top and
then I break a couple of them in half so
you've kind of got one and a half on top
I just think it looks kind of cute and
gives you a little bit more texture to
your Oreo cupcake cheesecakes these
cupcakes need to be stored in the fridge
right up until you're ready to serve
them but they also freeze up beautifully
so you can put them in an airtight
container in the freezer and you can
freeze them for up to a month and just
pull them out as you need them I hope
you guys loved this super simple no-bake
Oreo cookies and cream cheese cake
recipe make sure you subscribe to my
Copic addiction for more great Oreo
recipes including my homemade Oreo
cookie recipe my Oreo milk and cookies
shots recipe rainbow Oreos pac-man Oreos
and lots more as always thanks very much
for tuning in to my Copic addiction
